timeline.message: add sample rate rounding at config level
fit spec update: round with 4 digits
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:elastic/apm-agent-java into add-sampling-weight

timeline.bodyText: The spec talks about precision of 4 decimal places.
timeline.author: eyalkoren
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -162,14 +165,15 @@
             "You must use the query bar to filter for a specific environment in versions prior to 7.2.")
         .build();
 
-    private final ConfigurationOption<Double> sampleRate = ConfigurationOption.doubleOption()
+    private final ConfigurationOption<Double> sampleRate = RoundedDoubleConverter.withPrecision(3)

timeline.bodyText: The iteration through index is meant to avoid the allocation of iterator.
timeline.author: eyalkoren

timeline.bodyText:
This involves a lot of parsing and objects allocation with all those splits and iterations.
I wonder if we can avoid that by looking for indexof("es=").
See details in general comment.
timeline.author: eyalkoren

timeline.bodyText: It is a Recyclable type, why not reuse the same StringBuilder?
timeline.author: eyalkoren

timeline.bodyText: There is no caching for Double objects, use a constant instead of allocating every time (due to autoboxing).
timeline.author: eyalkoren

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                        "Value will be rounded with 3 significant digits, as an example, value '0.5555' will be rounded to `0.556`")
          
          
            
                        "Value will be rounded with 4 significance digits, as an example, value '0.55555' will be rounded to `0.5556`")
timeline.author: eyalkoren
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -162,14 +165,15 @@
             "You must use the query bar to filter for a specific environment in versions prior to 7.2.")
         .build();
 
-    private final ConfigurationOption<Double> sampleRate = ConfigurationOption.doubleOption()
+    private final ConfigurationOption<Double> sampleRate = RoundedDoubleConverter.withPrecision(4)
         .key(SAMPLE_RATE)
         .aliasKeys("sample_rate")
         .configurationCategory(CORE_CATEGORY)
         .tags("performance")
         .description("By default, the agent will sample every transaction (e.g. request to your service). " +
             "To reduce overhead and storage requirements, you can set the sample rate to a value between 0.0 and 1.0. " +
-            "We still record overall time and the result for unsampled transactions, but no context information, labels, or spans.")
+            "We still record overall time and the result for unsampled transactions, but no context information, labels, or spans.\n\n" +
+            "Value will be rounded with 3 significant digits, as an example, value '0.5555' will be rounded to `0.556`")

timeline.author: eyalkoren
eyalkoren

timeline.bodyText:
These are not cleared in resetState(). Regardless, caching per TraceState instance seems not as useful.
I think these state fields are only get set in setSampleRate(), which is only called in a single place (besides tests) with the value of the sampler.
What do you say about removing these states from here and instead add a String representation for the sample rate into Sampler implementations that is being calculated in the constructor, and a matching interface method? Then get it from the sampler when appending to the outgoing header. Take a look at https://github.com/elastic/apm-agent-java/blob/master/apm-agent-core/src/main/java/co/elastic/apm/agent/impl/ElasticApmTracer.java#L142-L147 - when the sampling rate config changes, a new PorbabilitySampler will be created, setting the proper string representation as well.
timeline.author: eyalkoren
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,181 @@

+ * under the License.

+package co.elastic.apm.agent.impl.transaction;
+
+import co.elastic.apm.agent.objectpool.Recyclable;
+
+import javax.annotation.Nullable;
+import java.util.ArrayList;
+import java.util.List;
+
+class TraceState implements Recyclable {
+
+    private static final char VENDOR_SEPARATOR = ',';
+    private static final char ENTRY_SEPARATOR = ';';
+    private static final String VENDOR_PREFIX = "es=";
+    private static final String SAMPLE_RATE_PREFIX = "s:";
+
+    /**
+     * List of tracestate header values
+     */
+    private final List<String> tracestate;
+
+    /**
+     * sample rate, null if unknown or not set
+     */
+    private double sampleRate;
+
+    // temp buffer used for rewriting
+    private final StringBuilder tempBuffer = new StringBuilder();
+
+    // cache to avoid rewriting same header many times when rate does not change
+    private double lastWrittenRate = Double.NaN;
+    @Nullable
+    private String lastWrittenHeader = null;

replies.bodyText: fixed in the last commit, we now have a static value stored in the sampler once for all.
replies.author: SylvainJuge

timeline.author: eyalkoren

timeline.bodyText: Why do we need this autoboxing? So we can have null? Can we use -1 (or any negative value) to denote that the sample rate was not set instead?
timeline.author: eyalkoren

replies.bodyText: fixed in last commit, we now use Double.NaN as a way to express the lack of value.
replies.author: SylvainJuge

timeline.bodyText: I think we can avoid the autoboxing to Double - a check of >= 0 can do the trick.
timeline.author: eyalkoren
eyalkoren

timeline.bodyText: We need to add handling to a situation where es= is found but it doesn't have the s: entry. In this case, we need to log a warning and decide on the sample rate. Maybe it should be 1.0?
timeline.author: eyalkoren

replies.bodyText:
This case is covered by the spec and we should not have a sample rate set

For non-root transactions the agent must parse incoming tracestate headers to identify the es entry and extract the s attribute. The s attribute value should be used to populate the sample_rate field of transactions and spans. If there is no tracestate or no valid es entry with an s attribute, then the agent must omit sample_rate from non-root transactions and their spans.

However I agree with you that we probably miss a corner test case on this one.
replies.author: SylvainJuge

replies.bodyText: And we should forward downstream as is, without adding it?
replies.author: eyalkoren

replies.bodyText:
That's how I understand the spec but that might not be consistent:

we currently fix rounding from upstream header if required
values < 0.0 and > 1.0, invalid or missing are just ignored, but we propagate them as-is when we might be able to "fix" them by using value from sampler.

Maybe just not propagating headers as-is when they aren't valid would make more sense.
replies.author: SylvainJuge

replies.bodyText:
I remember that the logic to add it or not depends on if the transaction is a root transaction or not:

if it's a root transaction: we add the sample_rate
if it's a child transaction and there is no valid upstream sample_rate, we do not add it so apm-server will use 1 as total distributed transaction weight (this behavior is the one used by agents that don't implement sample_rate, thus we keep it as-is for compatibility).
if it's a child transaction and there is a valid sample rate, we use and propagate it

Thus, to me the case where we have an invalid value (or no value) for sample rate is included in 2), but propagate as-is even if we know it's bogus is an open question.
replies.author: SylvainJuge

timeline.author: eyalkoren

replies.bodyText: I looked quickly at ruby (ref impl) and go agents, and both consider invalid values implies same behavior as if they were simply absent.
replies.author: SylvainJuge

replies.bodyText: OK, I guess other tests cover that
replies.author: eyalkoren

timeline.message:
Apply suggestions from code review

Co-authored-by: eyalkoren <41850454+eyalkoren@users.noreply.github.com>

timeline.bodyText:
I don't think we need this dependency in TraceState - enough to be able to get sampleRateAsString here and use the the StringBuilder in TraceState to append to the header when required. This means both no allocation and no dependency.
Sorry for nagging, but conceptually - a sampler shouldn't be aware of tracestate
timeline.author: eyalkoren

timeline.message: move appender to an inner class

timeline.author: eyalkoren

replies.bodyText: Thanks for catching this, there was one corner case to apply here though when tracestate is transmitted as-is and larger that the size limit we have to truncate it :-)
replies.author: SylvainJuge

timeline.message: revert optimization when there is single header
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:elastic/apm-agent-java into add-sampling-weight
